title: How to Put Themes on PSP

steps.headline: Select the theme desired whether downloaded from the internet or one that is already on your computer, place it in a location that is easily accessible such as a specified folder on your desktop.
Connect the PSP via a USB cable to your computer.
steps.description: The port is located at the top of the device.

steps.headline: Push the digital pad on the system (above the analog nub) to scroll all the way to the left on the cross- media bar to SETTINGS.
Scroll up or down to USB CONNECTION to highlight it and press the O button to enter.
steps.description: The screen will display the words USB Mode which assures that it was connected properly.

steps.headline: Wait for the window to pop up on the computer's screen with four options to choose from.
steps.description:
Select OPEN FOLDER TO VIEW FILES and click on it. Another window will take its place containing the data from the PSP's memory card in the form of a list of folders. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/32\/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/3\/32\/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid1484978-v4-728px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Select the PSP folder from the list.
Look inside and there will be a second list of various folders.
Locate the theme on your computer you wish to add by clicking on the assigned folder/file.
Drag and drop it into the PSP themes folder and wait for the duplication process to complete.
Press the X button on the PSP to return to SETTINGS.
Disconnect the USB cable from the computer and PSP.
Tap the digital pad down four times to highlight the THEME SETTINGS option and hit the O button to enter.
Press the O button again to enter.
steps.description:
A small window will slide into view from the right displaying a selection of various themes. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ef\/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-13Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/ef\/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-13Bullet1.jpg\/aid1484978-v4-728px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Scroll to the theme that was added just prior and select it with the O button.
Wait a moment while the PSP applies the new theme.

text:
Select the theme desired whether downloaded from the internet or one that is already on your computer, place it in a location that is easily accessible such as a specified folder on your desktop. Connect the PSP via a USB cable to your computer. The port is located at the top of the device. Push the digital pad on the system (above the analog nub) to scroll all the way to the left on the cross- media bar to SETTINGS. Scroll up or down to USB CONNECTION to highlight it and press the O button to enter. The screen will display the words USB Mode which assures that it was connected properly. Wait for the window to pop up on the computer's screen with four options to choose from. Select OPEN FOLDER TO VIEW FILES and click on it. Another window will take its place containing the data from the PSP's memory card in the form of a list of folders. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/3/32/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg/aid1484978-v4-728px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Select the PSP folder from the list. Look inside and there will be a second list of various folders. Choose the one labeled THEMES. Locate the theme on your computer you wish to add by clicking on the assigned folder/file. Drag and drop it into the PSP themes folder and wait for the duplication process to complete. Press the X button on the PSP to return to SETTINGS. Disconnect the USB cable from the computer and PSP. Tap the digital pad down four times to highlight the THEME SETTINGS option and hit the O button to enter. THEME will now be highlighted. Press the O button again to enter. A small window will slide into view from the right displaying a selection of various themes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-13Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/e/ef/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-13Bullet1.jpg/aid1484978-v4-728px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-13Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Scroll to the theme that was added just prior and select it with the O button. Wait a moment while the PSP applies the new theme. PLEASE WAIT will vanish from the screen when it finishes. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-15Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-15Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/7/77/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-15Bullet1.jpg/aid1484978-v4-728px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-15Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} The cross-media bar and the background will now have an entirely new look. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-15Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-15Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"/images/thumb/4/4a/Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-15Bullet2.jpg/aid1484978-v4-728px-Put-Themes-on-PSP-Step-15Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"546","licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}
